values:
I wrote this in August 2004 and gave it to Hannah Reed

About Myself...About Tofu

By Steven 

My life is a cube of tofu
It has no taste
whatsoever.
There's something to concider.
How can something 
that's definately there,
with a definate shape, consistancy
(we'll get to the consistancy later)
Not have a taste?
That is my life.
No taste. Flavour as you will
Salt as needed.

My life is a cube of tofu.
It gets spongy sometimes
when you cook it too long.
I hate tofu.
Yesturday I reverted to laziness.  I'll practice again on Monday.
Auston just gave me a banana, and someone just closed my door for me.
Last night was incredibly fake.  In 15 minutes I think I'm getting drug tested.

Today I had a nice lesson among other stuff, and I watched Ancherman for the first time.  Ancherman was essspecially funny, even though I didn't want to like it, so then I left and tried to find friends.  On fourth floor I found Danny Whittmer who was bored, and Mi Amore who was painting, and Geoff Wilson who's a recluse.

Then I ate pasta and sat on Sam's Couche.

Yesturday I threw down the cigar butt, and chose my weapon.  We, being me (Steven) and Josh, fought with most compassion; sidestepping shattered glass and evading the purple sky.  When we finished we listened to guitar.  Today I stalked the shadows of the Grey Building, and frightened sardines.  Now I listen to Modest Mouse.

He was a boy,
She was a girl,
Can I make it any more obvious?
He was a punk,
She did ballet,
What more can i say?

He wanted her, 
She'll never tell secretly she wanted him as well, 
But all of her friends,
Stuck up their nose, 
They had a problem with his baggy clothes. 

He was a sk8er boi,
She said see you later boy,
He wasn't good enough for her,
She had a pretty face,
But her head was up in space,
She needed to come back down to earth. 

5 years from now,
She sits at home,
Feeding the baby she's all alone,
She turns on TV,
Guess who she sees, 
Sk8er boi rockin up MTV.
She calls up her friends,
They already know,
And they've all got
Tickets to see his show.
She tags along, 
Stands in the crowd, 
Looks up at the man that she turned down.

He was a sk8er boi, 
She said see you later boy
He wasn't good enough for her. 
Now he's a super star,
Slamming on his guitar,
Does your pretty face see what he's worth?

He was a sk8er boi,
She said see you later boy,
He wasn't good enough for her,
Now he's a super star,
Slamming on his guitar,
Does your pretty face see what he's worth?

[[music]]

Sorry girl but you missed out, 
Well tough luck that boy's mine now, 
We are more than just good friends,
This is how this story ends.
Too bad that you couldn't see, 
See the man that boy could be.
There is more than meets the eye,
I see the soul that is inside.

He's just a boy, 
And I'm just a girl,
Can I make it anymore obvious?
We are in love,
Haven't you heard,
How we rock each others world?
(sing 2X)
I'm with the skater boy, 
I said see you later boy, 
I'll be back stage after the show, 
I'll be at the studio, 
Singing the song we wrote, 
About a girl you used to know.

My name is Steven.  And this is my quest for love which I will always pursue.  

I have lots of friends in wilkie woodland (show flash backs of him playing with whacky friends from wilkie woodland.  Trees, Pears, Wort Hogs, etc. etc.)

And they help me on my way to riches and glory.  (show flash backs of his whacky friends from wilkie woodland fighting with swords and frogs and shit.  Steven is fighting a big ass cockroach or something, and Penny the Pear, with her excellent swordsmanship, saves Steven in the nick of time, by turing on the lights.)  

What sorts of quests will you embark on?

What do you choose? 
(flash to pictures of crazy whacky friends playing instruments and drinking beer)

winkie woodland awaits you...

(flash to pictures of terrible demons and wearwolf stricken nights)
Catwoman was the worst movie I've ever seen, and I saw The Watcher.

Lately I've been doing this thing where I doubt myself when I type a period, and I think I've typed an 'M', so I put my ring finger on the backspace button, then I notice that I did infact type a period, but sense my finger is already there, I press backspace and retype the period.


Richie: I wrote a suicide note, after I gained consiousness."
Chas: Can we read it?
Richie: No
Chas: Can you try to paraphrase it for us?
Richie: I don't think so...
Chas: Was it dark?
Richie: Of course it was dark, it's a suicide note.
Trauma and Drama rhyme, and sometimes (in context) they mean the same things!
When I say "I am going to bed now," is bed a verb, or a noun?

Passionate Kisses

Mary Chapin Carpenter

Is it too much to ask
I want a comfortable bed that won't hurt my back
Food to fill me up
And warm clothes and all that stuff
Shouldn't I have this
Shouldn't I have this
Shouldn't I have all of this, and

Passionate kisses
Passionate kisses, whoa oh oh
Passionate kisses from you

Is it too much to demand
I want a full house and a rock and roll band
Pens that won't run out of ink
And cool quiet and time to think
Shouldn't I have this
Shouldn't I have this
Shouldn't I have all of this, and

Passionate kisses
Passionate kisses, whoa oh oh
Passionate kisses from you

Do I want too much
Am I going overboard to want that touch
I shout it out to the night
"Give me what I deserve, 'cause it's my right"
Shouldn't I have this (shouldn't I)
Shouldn't I have this (shouldn't I)
Shouldn't I have all of this, and

Passionate kisses
Passionate kisses, whoa oh oh
Passionate kisses from you
Passionate kisses
Passionate kisses, whoa oh oh
Passionate kisses from you

I met a traveler from an antique land
Who said: Two vast and trunkless legs of stone
Stand in the desert. Near them, on the sand,
Half sunk, a shattered visage lies, whose frown,
And wrinkled lip, and sneer of cold command,
Tell that its sculptor well those passions read,
Which yet survive, stamped on these lifeless things,
The hand that mocked them, and the heart that fed,
And on the pedestal these words appear:
"My name is Ozymandias, King of Kings:
Look upon my works, ye Mighty, and despair!"
Nothing beside remains. Round the decay
Of that colossal wreck, boundless and bare
The lone and level sands stretch far away. 

Percy Bysshe Shelly

I said to myself, "Steven, there aren't enough metephorical poems about Tofu!"  So here it is.

They've started sweetening the glue on the back of envelopes to make for easier licking...

Just thought that was worth mentioning.

Now I know what kind of man to go after

You Should Date An Italian!

You love for old fashioned romance, with an old fashioned guy
An Italian guy is the perfect candidate to be your prince charming
If your head doesn't spin enough, just down another espresso with him
Invest in a motorcycle helmet - and some carb blocker for all that pasta!

Which Foreign Guy Should You Date? Take This Quiz :-)

Find the Love of Your Life (and More Love Quizzes) at Your New Romance.
Aside from taking tests that I probably shouldn't be taking, my day was great. I went to a camp party at Audrey's house and got to see most of my friends from camp. The party consisted of me, Lillian, Stephanie, Audrey, Katie, and Bridget...so I was kinda the only guy there. ::evil laugh::

About an hour ago, I got back from my friends house, and found out that I was accepted into the North Carolina School of the arts for my sophmore year in highschool!

I'll put the interesting parts of the letter here for all my fans to read. (yeah right)

Dear Steven:

Congratulations!  You have been accepted for admission to the North Carolina School of the Arts as a High School Diploma candidate for the 10th grade, majoring in Music beginning in the fall term of 2004.  Your acceptance is a testament to your artistic achievement and potential.  Your enrollment is contingent upon successful completion of your current curriculum.

BLAH BLAH BLAH

We are excited to have you continue your artistic training at North Carolina School of the Arts.

So today, the weekly privot saxophone lessons started up again.  After the lesson, my teacher Art had nothing to do, so he took me to the Tate Street Coffee House down the road from UNCG.  Being the uncultured country boy I am, I've never been to a coffee house, and the only thing I've ever had in coffee is hazelnut Coffee Mate.  It was really cool to just talk about stuff, and not have him be a teacher for 5 minutes.

So he said he was going to call Dr. Kalyn the head of the NCSA School of Music, and see where I stand.  I don't know how much he'll find out, if he finds anything out at all, but it'll be a nice jesture.

I kicked audition ASS!  Then I kicked interveiw ass!  I won't know for another couple weeks if I'm in or not, but I know I played my best today, and I'm proud of myself reguardless of what the outcome is.

PS:  If I get in, my highschool sophmore class is estimated to be about 20.

Tomorow is my audition for the school of the arts.

Wish me luck!
3 days.  I am beginning to see some light.  I know I can do it, if I really really devote myself.  I want this so much right now, and If I try hard enough, I know I can get it.

4 days until my audition, then after that, I'm not touching my saxophone for a month.

I'm freaking out.  If anyone knows any special was of calming your soul with tai chi or something, please let me know because I am about to start pulling my hair out with stress.

elements are Small
apples, bread, coffee.

two.

By:
Steven Troncale

Count the squares on the ceiling
feeling rhymes with ceiling
nothing rhymes with Orange
Isn't that disapointing?

Anghst, pain, suffering
Diliberately Blue
sad stuff
in the Yellow Submarine,
Yeah.  That's a thinker.
